1. Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs)

CVDs are a class of diseases that affect the heart and blood vessels. They are the leading cause of death and disability worldwide. The major types of CVDs include coronary artery disease, stroke, heart failure, hypertensive heart disease, rheumatic heart disease, and congenital heart disease. The risk factors for CVDs include high blood pressure, high cholesterol, diabetes, obesity, smoking, and physical inactivity. The treatment for CVDs may involve medications, lifestyle modifications, and surgical procedures. Some common medications used to treat CVDs include aspirin, statins, beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors, and diuretics.
